document.masterDocTitle: Description of a new species of Paracrobeles Heyns, 1968 (Nematoda, Rhabditida, Cephalobidae) from Kelso Dunes, Mojave National Preserve, California, USA

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of a new species of Paracrobeles Heyns, 1968 (Nematoda, Rhabditida, Cephalobidae) from Kelso Dunes, Mojave National Preserve, California, USA

subSubSection.paragraph:
Key to species of
Paracrobeles
(emended after
Abolafia et al. 2014
;

paragraph.keyLead: – Spicules more than 40 µm long, primary axils with single guarding process................................... 4
– Vulva at 60–71% of body length, primary axils with two guarding processes ................................. 3

3. Metastegostom tooth absent ........................
P. mojavicus Taylor, Baldwin & Mundo-Ocampo, 2004

keyLead.paragraph:
– Metastegostom tooth present, anteriorly directed .......................................
P. kelsodunensis
sp. nov.

caption.paragraph:
Table 2. Morphometrics of
Paracrobeles
species. Measurements in μm (except L, in mm) (emended from
Abolafia et al. , 2014
). * Measured from the illustrations or calculated from other measurements; ** times the corresponding body diameter; – indicates that data are not applicable; 1
Abolafia et al. (2014)
; 2 Heyns (1968) ; 3
Rashid et al. (1990)
; 4
Taylor et al. (2004)
; 5 Navarro & Lluch (1999) ; 6 Orselli & Vinciguerra (2002) ; 7 Present paper.

keyLead.paragraph:
4. Lips with three tines (including the ones in secondary axils); postvulval sac not swollen ................. ..............................................................
P. deserticola Abolafia, Divsalar, Panahi & Shokoohi, 2014

paragraph.keyLead:
– Lips with four tines (including the ones in secondary axils); postvulval sac swollen ........................ ...........................................................................................
P. psammophilus Navarro & Lluch, 1999
